data.title: HelpTeaching.com Scholarship
data.description: HelpTeaching.com is proudly offering a $1,000 scholarship to undergraduate students who are creative enough to write a short story or informational article for children.  High school and college students are eligible to apply.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: SHORT STORY FOR CHILDREN
texts.description:
Applicants should submit a short story or informational article for children (400-800 words) 
Stories and articles will be rated from 0-5 based on the following criteria: Creativity/Innovation, Value to Students, Quality of Content, and Grammar, Spelling, and Punctuation.

Please attach your story.

data.title: Hiking Ambition Wellness Scholarship
data.description: Hiking Ambition has created a scholarship program that offers a $1,000 award to students that are committed to a healthy lifestyle or have passion for hiking.  High school students, undergraduate and graduate students that are passionate about a healthy lifestyle and hiking are welcome to apply.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Healthy Lifestyle
texts.description:
Please create a piece of content between 500–1,000 words (and attach below in Word or PDF format) promoting a practical approach to a healthy lifestyle during high school, college or university years (whichever is relevant to you) and how these habits can be sustained over a lifetime.
***In the top left corner of your essay please provide the following information: Your full name, phone, address, email, name of school and area of study.***

data.title: Job Application Scholarship
data.description: As a largest direct job application site, JobApplicationDB.com is there to help those seeking a job.  This time they are looking to help students out with their education by giving away a $1,000 scholarship. All high school and college students are eligible.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Job Application Scholarship
texts.description:
Please answer the following questions. Use up to 100 words for each question. Your application should be between 500-1000 words:

-What is your field of education? Why did you choose this field?
-What motivates you?
-What is the biggest challenge you have overcome in the last year?
-Tell us about a time when you failed and what you learned from it.
-In your view, what is the most important thing to be successful?
-Have you done internships, part-time work or full-time work before? If so briefly describe the key learning you took from your experience if not, what would you looking to learn from your first such experience
-How did you find about the scholarship?
-Have you received any other scholarships or financial aid for the current year or for the previous year?
-What is your career goal?
-Which company would you like to work for and why? (Assuming you don’t start your own company)

Attach your work below.

data.title: Enthusiast Scholarship
data.description: The team at List Enthusiast know how difficult it is to cover educational expenses today which is why they wish to help one student each year by giving away a $1,500 scholarship.  All students are welcome to apply, even all high school students are eligible.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Enthusiast Scholarship
texts.description:
Send us a 1000+ words article (.doc file) on:
Since we write about different types of topics on List Enthusiast, you can literally send us article about any technology, gadget or even something informative-yet-interesting. It can be in the form of a list like the rest of articles on our site e.g. “Top 10 Best Earbuds 2016,“ but that’s not compulsory. Our major criteria will be analysis through Google Analytics metrics like Bounce rate, Bounce time, exit ratio, social shares etc.

In addition, you’ll also provide below listed information in top left corner:

Full name, phone#, email ID, name of the high school/college/university you’re currently enrolled, and lastly your city, state and country.

data.title: Sole Door Cooking Scholarship
data.description: Sole Door is proudly offering a $1,000 scholarship to all students who have passion for cooking and a healthy lifestyle.  This scholarship opportunity is open to students pursuing all majors, however we are looking for those who know how to express their passion for cooking. The winning student will get a chance to get a paid internship with Sole Door. Minor applicants need permission from parents to apply.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Cooking Healthy
texts.description:
Write and attach your story between 1000 and 2000 words about cooking recipes or tips in which you emphasize the importance of a healthy diet and promote a healthy lifestyle through cooking.

Example: ​Best Charcoal Grill Reviews: Top 5 Picks That Exists Today (https://soledoor.com/best-charcoal-grill-reviews/)

Keep in mind that your story must impress us enough so we are forced to give you the prize. We are looking for original and creative papers that strive with interest and burst with positive energy. Speak up and let us enjoy your inner voice!

Please include your complete personal data, including the name of your institution you are attending (high school, college or university).

data.title: EssayPro Writing Contest Scholarship
data.description: EssayPro is looking for future Shakespeare writers.  They are now offering students across the world a chance to submit their good written work for an award.  First place winner will get a $500 award and second and third place winners will get $250 each.  All high school and college students are eligible to apply.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: EssayPro Writing Contest
texts.description:
We would like to invite all of our soon-to-be Shakespeares to take part in our weekly contests! If you feel like your work is worth more than just good grades, then hop on in! For the first of our essay contests we have chosen topics that college and university face most often. Choose one of the following:

1. Is Technology Our Friend?
2. What really is the American Dream?
3. This is What I Believe In:
4. An essay on the principle of population
5. Abortion: Choice or Murder?
6. What is Respect?
7. Do Humans Understand Each Other?
8. Nature vs Nurture
9. Should a Person Give Up on Career for the Sake of Family? 
10. Life Goals vs Family Values
11. The Double Edged Sword that is Gun Control.

WE WILL CHECK for plagiarism if there is any. Send your work in a Microsoft Word document (600-800 words).
You can include images in your work, especially if they illustrate the topic or your own ideas. This will only grow our attention!

data.title: Steadyfoot Scholarship
data.description: Steadyfoot.com is proudly offering a $500 scholarship to all high school, undergraduate and graduate students.  In an effort to make the educational expenses a little less of a struggle for students and their families.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: The Steadyfoot Scholarship Program
texts.description:
Please write and attach an essay on the following topic (around 500 words):
Running is one of the easiest and most affordable physical activities, but running injuries inevitably happen making it almost impossible for runners to keep running. Some foot issues include “plantar fasciitis, bad knees, bunions, shin splints …)

Choose an injury and talk about it outlining how running can lead to it. Then, suggest some remedies to treat or ease the pain as well as a list of footwear that proved to be effective for that condition.

Here are some of the most common foot injuries:
-Plantar Fasciitis
-Runner’s Knee
-Shin Splints
-Achilles Tendinitis
-Illiotibial Band Syndrome
-Hip Pain
The title of the essay should be “The Steadyfoot Scholarship Program”.

data.title: ThePensters Scholarship
data.description: ThePensters is a professional custom writing service that is now offering a $1,000 scholarship to a student that writes the most creative essay. Applicants can be high school or college/university students.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Virtual Reality Classes
texts.description:
Write and attach an essay between 500 and 700 words by responding to the question:

- Will virtual reality classes replace traditional education?

Please write about three reasons for believing in your thesis statement in the form of body paragraphs and back up your reasons with viable evidence from respected sources. Do not write about yourself and don’t try to explain why you deserve to win the scholarship. We only care about the quality of your writing. 

Any point of view is acceptable, but use credible evidence in your essay. Your essay should contain introduction, body paragraphs and a conclusion. Write about topics that include field of education. Topics within the prompt can include these areas of focus and more: poetry education, education for free, education without teachers, learning to write letters in different languages, creative education for kids, future of fiction writing education, applications for virtual universities, money in education, the future of literary education, online education through websites, require adults to be educated, student learning from writers and poets, international virtual high school, learning to write everything virtually, from an application letter to a nonfiction book or novel.

***Make sure to include your contact information with your essay (top left corner):

-name/middle name/surname
-college/high school
-year of graduation
-major
-phone number
-email

data.title: Vegetarian Video Scholarship
data.description: Vegetarian Resource Group is all about educating people on vegetarianism and veganism. They are looking to award three students with the best vegetarian video by giving the top student a $200 scholarship and two other students $100 awards each.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Video and Description
texts.description:
Create a video relating to what you want to tell others about vegetarianism and/or veganism.

Some possible topics: 

- food 
- nutrition 
- your feelings about veganism and/or vegetarianism
- water usage and vegetarianism
- vegetarianism and animal rights
- or other vegetarian topics which appeal to you.

Humor and feelings are appreciated. All videos should be positive, not be critical of anyone, and not include any footage of animal cruelty. You may submit a video you have already made.

*Please paste your link below.

***Make sure to include a brief statement on why you are interested in vegetarianism. If you are under 18, please include a parent or guardian's permission for entry and use of the video.***

data.title: AIEZ Driver Safety Scholarship
data.description: AIEZ's goal is to make people aware of the cheaper car insurance and now they are offering a $1,000 scholarship to the student with best essay. High school students are eligible to apply.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Automotive Accidents
texts.description:
In 2015, after nearly a decade of steady decline, the rate of automobile accident fatalities shot up by over 10% in a single year.  

Write and attach an essay up to 1,500 words answering on following questions:

- What can the nation as a whole do to decrease automotive accidents and promote driver safety?
- What can/should states do to decrease automotive accidents and promote driver safety?
- What should cities, towns, municipalities, and local communities do to decrease automotive accidents and promote driver safety?
- What can you, as an individual and a young driver, do to decrease automotive accidents and promote driver safety?

Many automotive insurance companies encourage driver safety with lucrative discounts, lower rates for safe drivers, and a push towards more driver training education. They are doing their part. But can local communities do more? Should we be doing more at the state level? And are there any steps that the federal government can take to make sure that dangerous driving stops taking so many lives? In your essay, try your best to tackle these important driver safety issues.

Make sure your essay is original work.

data.title: The Project Paradigm Challenge
data.description: ProjectParadigm.org is looking for new ideas when it comes to reducing waste. They are giving away $100,000 to a 100 students with the most creative ideas. If applying with friends, funds will get split. If applying individually, the grand prize winner will get $25,000 as well as tickets to Disneyland and a trip to LA for the ceremony. There will be more awards given away starting from $50 up to $5,000. Students must be 18 or under on May 1, 2017 to apply.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Reducing Waste
texts.description:
Create a video and paste the link below that talks about reducing waste in your home, school, community, or around the world. All you need is an idea, you are not required to build or implement your idea. Include an explanation of your idea below it and include your name, month of birth and year of birth.

To help you come up with an idea, here is a list of common type of waste: 

- food 
- water
- energy
- electronics
- deforestation
- hazardous waste
- packaging
- cars and tires
- sewage

***You may apply by yourself or include friends (that are 18 and under on May 1, 2017) to project. Make sure to also include their names, month of birth and year of birth. A $100,000 award will get split between you and your friends.***

Do a good research on your topic to be sure that all information in your essay is correct. Your essay must be original and creative.

data.title: TechRagon.com Scholarship Program
data.description: Techragon is aware of how education is important in life. Therefore they are proud to offer three scholarships to students who have passion for technology. First-prize winner will get $1,000, second- and third-place winners will get $500 each.

texts.name: Essay
texts.title: Technology
texts.description:
To participate in the following scholarship program you have to write and submit an essay that consists of more than or equal to 1500 words. The higher word count may get you a chance of winning.

The topic for this essay will be “What are the benefits and demerits of having latest technology gadgets, how should the technology be used for better human development“.

Hints for the Essay:

- How is Technology used in our day-to-day life?
- What are the problems and demerits caused by excess use of technology?
- How can uneducated be informed about uses of technology?
- What are the advantages of having latest technology?

Make sure your essay is original, convincing and creative work. Attach as a Microsoft Word document. 

***The essay should contain at least 3-4 images.***

***In the top left-hand corner include your personal details, name of school/university/college, and area of education.
